definition: To examine something carefully in order to understand it or explain it.
example: Researchers analyze the survey responses before drawing conclusions.

definition: A method or way of dealing with a situation or problem.
example: Her collaborative approach to teaching boosted class participation.

definition: To evaluate the quality, ability, or value of something.
example: Teachers assess each essay using a detailed rubric.

definition: To accept something as true without proof.
example: We cannot assume the policy will work in every context.

definition: The power or right to give orders, make decisions, or control something.
example: The city authority approved the new housing development.

definition: Able to be used, obtained, or reached.
example: Several scholarships are available for international students.

definition: An advantage, profit, or positive effect gained from something.
example: Regular exercise provides a clear benefit to mental health.

definition: An abstract idea or general notion.
example: The concept of sustainable growth guides the company's strategy.

definition: Always behaving or happening in the same way; compatible.
example: She delivered consistent results during the entire project.

definition: The circumstances or background that form the setting for an event or idea.
example: You need to understand the context before interpreting the remark.

definition: To bring something into existence or cause something new to happen.
example: The designers create prototypes to test their ideas quickly.

definition: Facts and statistics collected for reference or analysis.
example: The lab stored all climate data in a shared repository.

definition: To explain the meaning of a word or idea precisely.
example: The contract must define each technical term clearly.

definition: To obtain or develop something from a particular source.
example: Scientists derive new hypotheses from previous studies.

definition: The system of production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.
example: Tourism plays a vital role in the island's economy.

definition: The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.
example: A calm environment helps children concentrate on homework.

definition: To set up or create something on a firm or lasting basis.
example: The university plans to establish a new research center.

definition: Facts or information indicating whether something is true or valid.
example: There is strong evidence that the program improves literacy.

definition: Something that contributes to a result or outcome.
example: Price is an important factor when consumers choose a product.

definition: The management of money, banking, investments, and other financial instruments.
example: She studied finance to learn how markets allocate capital.

definition: A mathematical rule or chemical relationship expressed in symbols.
example: The students memorized the formula for calculating area.

definition: The purpose or role that something is designed to perform.
example: This button's function is to reset the device.

definition: To recognize or establish what something is.
example: The software can identify errors in the dataset automatically.

definition: Money received regularly for work or investments.
example: Their household income increased after the promotion.

definition: To point out, show, or suggest something.
example: Survey results indicate growing support for the reform.

definition: To explain the meaning of information, words, or actions.
example: Historians interpret the letters to understand daily life in the past.

definition: To include or require as a necessary part.
example: The internship will involve both fieldwork and laboratory analysis.

definition: An important topic or problem for debate or discussion.
example: Climate change remains a central issue in the election campaign.

definition: Work, especially physical work, or the workers as a group.
example: New regulations aim to protect labor in hazardous industries.

definition: Related to the law or permitted by law.
example: You must seek legal advice before signing the agreement.

definition: Very large, important, or serious.
example: The storm caused major damage to coastal towns.

definition: A particular way of doing something, especially a systematic one.
example: The scientific method requires careful observation and testing.

definition: To happen or take place.
example: Several minor errors occur when the system is overloaded.

definition: One part in every hundred; a proportion.
example: Unemployment dropped by two percent last year.

definition: A length or portion of time.
example: The course covers the medieval period in European history.

definition: A course or principle of action adopted by an organization or individual.
example: The company introduced a policy to encourage remote work.

definition: A fundamental rule or belief that guides behavior or reasoning.
example: Honesty is a principle that guides her decisions.

definition: To begin or continue a course of action.
example: Once everyone agrees, we can proceed with the plan.

definition: A series of actions taken to achieve a particular result.
example: Quality control is built into every step of the process.

definition: To need something or make something necessary.
example: Most graduate programs require letters of recommendation.

definition: Systematic investigation to discover or establish facts.
example: They received a grant to conduct research on renewable energy.

definition: To reply or react to something.
example: The spokesperson will respond to questions after the briefing.

definition: The part played by a person or thing in a particular situation.
example: Parents play a crucial role in early language development.

definition: A distinct part or subdivision of something.
example: Please read the safety section before operating the machine.

definition: A distinct part of an area of activity, especially economic.
example: The technology sector grew rapidly this quarter.

definition: Important or meaningful; having a noticeable effect.
example: There was a significant improvement in test scores.

definition: Having a resemblance or likeness.
example: The twins have similar interests and hobbies.

definition: The place or person from which something originates.
example: The journalist checked every source before publishing the article.

definition: The arrangement of parts in an organism, object, or system.
example: The bridge's steel structure can withstand high winds.

definition: A system of ideas intended to explain something.
example: According to the theory, supply and demand reach equilibrium.

definition: To differ or change from one instance to another.
example: Student needs vary depending on their background.

definition: To successfully reach a goal, usually through effort.
example: She worked hard to achieve top marks in the exam.

definition: To gain possession or control of something.
example: You can acquire new skills through continuous practice.

definition: To influence or cause a change in something.
example: Rising prices affect every household budget.

definition: Suitable or proper for a particular situation.
example: Choose an appropriate tone when writing formal emails.

definition: A particular part or feature of something.
example: The cultural aspect of the program attracts many participants.

definition: To help someone or make a task easier.
example: Volunteers assist visitors during the festival.

definition: A group of things sharing common characteristics.
example: Please select the correct category for your expense report.

definition: A main division of a book or document.
example: Chapter three explains the study's methodology.

definition: An official group tasked with a particular function, or the act of assigning a task.
example: The government formed a commission to investigate the accident.

definition: A group of people living in the same place or sharing common interests.
example: The community organized a cleanup of the local park.

definition: Consisting of many different and connected parts; not simple.
example: Managing the supply chain is a complex challenge.

definition: To calculate a result using mathematics or computers.
example: The program can compute thousands of records in seconds.

definition: To bring something to an end or to reach a judgment.
example: We can conclude from the evidence that the policy succeeded.

definition: To organize and carry out an activity or to behave in a certain way.
example: Researchers conduct interviews with local residents.

definition: A result or effect of an action or condition.
example: One consequence of the drought is higher food prices.

definition: To build or form something by putting parts together.
example: Engineers will construct a new bridge over the river.

definition: To use up or eat resources or goods.
example: Modern appliances consume less electricity than older models.

definition: Praise or recognition for an achievement; also the ability to obtain goods before payment.
example: She received credit for improving the training program.

definition: The customs, arts, and social institutions of a group of people.
example: Studying abroad helps students understand another culture.

definition: To plan the form or structure of something.
example: Architects design buildings that balance beauty and function.

definition: Clearly separate and different from something else.
example: The study identifies three distinct patterns of behavior.

definition: A basic or essential part of something.
example: Trust is a key element of effective teamwork.

definition: To consider one thing to be the same as another.
example: We should not equate wealth with happiness.

definition: To judge or determine the value or quality of something.
example: The committee will evaluate the grant proposals next week.

definition: A distinctive attribute or aspect of something.
example: This smartphone's main feature is its high-resolution camera.

definition: Coming at the end; last.
example: The final report is due at the end of the month.

definition: To concentrate attention or effort on something.
example: This semester we will focus on academic writing.

definition: A strong effect or influence on something.
example: The new policy had a positive impact on employment.

definition: To harm or damage a person or thing.
example: Falling debris could injure workers at the site.

definition: To establish something, especially an organization or system.
example: The board voted to institute stricter safety measures.

definition: To put money, time, or effort into something expecting a return.
example: The firm will invest in modernizing its factories.

definition: A magazine or record that publishes academic or professional information.
example: She submitted her findings to a medical journal.

definition: To keep something in good condition or continue a state.
example: Technicians maintain the equipment every month.

definition: Usual, typical, or expected.
example: After the repairs, production returned to normal levels.

definition: To get or acquire something.
example: Students must obtain a permit before using the laboratory.

definition: To take part in an activity or event.
example: Thousands will participate in the city marathon.

definition: To become aware of or understand something through the senses or mind.
example: Consumers perceive the brand as reliable.

definition: Hopeful, constructive, or expressing approval.
example: She offered a positive response to the proposal.

definition: Having the capacity to develop into something in the future.
example: The startup has enormous potential for growth.

definition: Existing or happening before the present time.
example: Please include data from the previous year as well.

definition: Most important; main.
example: Cost remains the primary concern for many buyers.

definition: To buy something.
example: They decided to purchase new laboratory equipment.

definition: The extent or scope of something between limits.
example: This model offers a wide range of customization options.

definition: A particular area or division of the world or a country.
example: The mountain region attracts tourists year-round.

definition: To control or direct according to rules or laws.
example: New policies will regulate emissions from factories.

definition: Closely connected or applicable to the matter at hand.
example: Only submit documents that are relevant to the claim.

definition: A supply of materials, money, or assets that can be used.
example: Water is a precious resource in arid climates.

definition: A person who lives in a particular place.
example: Every resident received a survey about public transport.

definition: The state of being free from danger or threat.
example: Airport security has been tightened this summer.
